intro: Arytera divaricata, commonly known as the variable leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. The plant typically grows as a succulent shrub with fleshy, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insects, making it an important species in its ecosystem.
